vr:Summary.vr:Description: Descriptions of tables and columns in the view of the INT-WFS catalogue available to the ADQL service. These metadata are constructed to suit the AstroGrid query builder in AstroGrid iteration 7.

Table.Name: obj
Table.vr:Description:
The INT wide-field survey is an imaging survey in 9 filter-bands.
In the original data, each observation, to which a unique run-number is attached, images one field in one filter-band. Not all areas of the sky in the survey have been observed in all bands and some have been been observed more than once in a given band.
The intermediate data-sets are catalogues of celestial objects detected in the images. There is one of these catalogues per run-number. Each row of these intermediate catalogues contains data about one celestial object taken from one observation in one filter-band.
This is a merged object-catalogue made by positional matching between objects in the intermediate catalogues. Each row of this catalogue describes one celestial object, but may contain data from more than one observation. For each photometric quantity, there is one column for each of the nine bands. These columns contains nulls where the object is not detected in that filter-band.

Column.Name: objID
Column.Description: Some index number for the celestial object

Column.Name: ra
Column.Description: Right ascension of celestial object

Column.Name: dec
Column.Description: Declination of celestial object

Column.Name: htmID
Column.Description: Hierarchical Triangular Mesh Index

Column.Name: run_U
Column.Description: INT run-number of observation yielding U-band photometry

Column.Name: ccd_U
Column.Description: Number of CCD chip in the camera on which the object falls, U-band observation

Column.Name: number_U
Column.Description: Number of object in catalogue for single observation, U band

Column.Name: offsetRa_U
Column.Description: Offset of RA measured in U-band observation from that in ra column

Column.Name: offsetDec_U
Column.Description: Offset of declination measured in U-band observation from that in dec column

Column.Name: x_U
Column.Description: Position of object on CCD, x coordinate, U-band observation

Column.Name: y_U
Column.Description: Position of object on CCD, y coordinate, U-band observation

Column.Name: flux_U
Column.Description: Photometric flux in U band (instrumental scale)

Column.Name: fluxErr_U
Column.Description: Uncertainty in photometric flux, U band (instrumental scale)

Column.Name: U
Column.Description: Photometric magnitude in U band

Column.Name: Err_U
Column.Description: Uncertainty in photometric magnitude, U band

Column.Name: type_U
Column.Description: Star/galaxy/noise classification-code, derived from U-band observation

Column.Name: isoPhi_U
Column.Description: Position angle of isophotes of object, derived from U-band observation

Column.Description: INT run-number of observation yielding g-band photometry

Summary.Description: Multi-band photometry of objects detected in INT-WFS images.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: Query
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Astronomy Data Query Language that defines the search criteria

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: Format
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: How the results are to be returned. VOTABLE or CSV for now

Summary.Description: Multi-band photometry of objects detected in INT-WFS images.

Resource.Title: SIAP service for the INT wide-field survey

Summary.Description: A Simple Image Access Protocol service for the reduced images of the Isaac Newton Telescope wide-field survey.

Resource.Subject: A Simple Image Access Protocol service for the reduced images of the Isaac Newton Telescope wide-field survey.

Summary.Description: List of observations in the INT wide-field survey.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: Query
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Astronomy Data Query Language that defines the search criteria

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: Format
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: How the results are to be returned. VOTABLE or CSV for now

Summary.Description: List of observations in the INT wide-field survey.

vr:Summary.vr:Description: The "Data Quality Control catalogue for the INT wide-field survey. It lists details of INT-WFS observations and data-reductions.

Column.Name: ramas
Column.Description: Right ascension of celestial object

Column.Name: decmas
Column.Description: Declination of celestial object

Column.Name: equinox
Column.Description: Equinox of the coordinates in columns ramas and decmas.

Column.Name: objname
Column.Description: Name of the target of the observation. May be the name of a celestial object or of a survey field.

Column.Name: am
Column.Description: Characteristic airmass of the observation.

Column.Name: pa
Column.Description: Position angle of the camera at observation.

Column.Name: run
Column.Description: Number of exposure (run number in ING archive)

Column.Name: ccd
Column.Description: Number of the CCD (1..4) which generated the image described in this record. The nominal centre of the camera is on CCD number 4.

Column.Name: obsdate
Column.Description: Date of observation

Column.Name: obsut
Column.Description: Time of observation (UTC) in the format hh:mm:ss.

Column.Name: exptime
Column.Description: Exposure time

Columns.Name: filter
Columns.Description: Name of filter passband. This seems to be always the short name of the band, e.g., R, g, i or z, without distinctions of photometric system.

Column.Name: seeing
Column.Description: Seeing: FWHM of the average, measured point-spread function in this image.

Column.Name: sky
Column.Description: k-sigma clipped estimate of the "median" sky brightness for the frame after removing background gradients.

Column.Name: noise
Column.Description: k-sigma clipped MAD (Median of the Absolute Deviation from the median) estimate for the sky noise after removing background gradients. Scaled (ie. x 1.48) to an equivalent Gaussian RMS value.

Column.Name: ellipt
Column.Description: Average ellipticity of star images. The ellipticity indicates slight trailing of the image during observation; a perfect image has zero ellipticity.

Column.Name: apcor
Column.Description: Stellar image aperture correction for the default recommended aperture measure, diameter =2*FWHM, employed in WFS object catalogues.

Column.Name: stdrms
Column.Description: RMS error in astrometric fit error either single CCD or average of the four CCDs.

Column.Name: magzpt
Column.Description: Photometric zero point for magnitude calculations assuming default extinction, based on a combination of nightly measures from photometric standards and trend over the appropriate WFC run.

Column.Name: magzrr
Column.Description: Photometric zero point error estimated from a combination of nightly measures of photometric standards and trend over the WFC run.

Column.Name: maglim
Column.Description: Magnitude corresponding to the 5-sigma flux limit for the standard aperture photometry measure.

Column.Name: proposal
Column.Description: Name of the observing proposal under which the data were taken.

Column.Name: Comments
Column.Description: Comments on the data, generated both automatically to flag problems in the FITS header information used to generate the tables, and in some cases manually to provide additional quality control information.
